qas.question: Who designed the Cathedral of Brasília?
What type of structure is the Cathedral of Brasília?
When was the Cathedral of Brasília dedicated?
How many identical columns are used in the Cathedral of Brasília?
How much do the Cathedral of Brasília's columns weigh?

plausible_answers.text: 70 m (229.66 ft) diameter of the circular area

qas.question: How many parts of the capital were reaching up to heaven?
How much does the glass weigh?

context: The Cathedral of Brasília in the capital of the Federative Republic of Brazil, is an expression of the architect <a0_0><b6_0>Oscar Niemeyer<b6_0/><a0_0/>. This <a1_0>concrete-framed hyperboloid<a1_0/> structure, seems with its glass roof reaching up, open, to the heavens. <b5_0>On 31 May 1970<b5_0/>, the Cathedral’s structure was finished, and only the <b7_0>70 m (229.66 ft) diameter of the circular area<b7_0/> were visible. Niemeyer's project of Cathedral of Brasília is based in the hyperboloid of revolution which sections are asymmetric. The hyperboloid structure itself is a result of <a3_0>16<a3_0/> identical assembled concrete columns. These columns, having hyperbolic section and weighing <a4_0><b9_0>90 t<b9_0/><a4_0/>, represent two hands moving upwards to heaven. The Cathedral was dedicated on <a2_0><b8_0>31 May 1970<b8_0/><a2_0/>.
